gurmukhi: ੳੁਲਟਿ ਪਵਨ ਮਨ ਮੀਨ ਕੀ ਚਪਲ ਗਤਿ ਸੁਖਮਨਾ ਸੰਗਮ ਕੈ ਬ੍ਹਮ ਸਥਾਨ ਹੈ
transliteration: Ulati Pavan Man Meen Kee Chapal Gati , Soukhamanaa Sangam Kai Braham Sadaan Hai ?
translation: By the practice of Naam Simran, Guru-conscious disciples are able to control the wayward and frolicsome mind and with sharp fish-like movement harbour their consciousness in the Dasam Duar (tenth opening), the meeting place of Irha, Pingla and Sukhmana. T

gurmukhi: ਸਾਗਰ ਸਲਿਲ ਗਹਿ ਗਗਨ ਘਟਾ ਘਮੰਡ ੳੁਨਮਨ ਮਗਨ ਲਗਨ ਗੁਰ ਗਿਅਾਨ ਹੈ
transliteration: Saagar Salil Gahi Gagan Ghataa Ghamanda , Ounaman Magan Lagan Gur Giaan Hai ?
translation: With their consciousness resting in the Dasam Duar, they integrate themselves in the light eternal of the Lord just as the river merges with the water of the ocean. They remain in the ecstatic state of Naam Simran and all their interest and devotion remai

gurmukhi: ਜੋਤਿ ਮੈ ਜੋਤੀ ਸਰੂਪ ਦਾਮਨੀ ਚਮਤਕਾਰ ਗਰਜਤ ਅਨਹਦ ਸਬਦ ਨੀਸਾਨ ਹੈ
transliteration: Joti Mai Jotee Saroop Daamanee Chamatakaara , Garajat Anahad Sabad Neesaan Hai ?
translation: By melding into the super radiance of the Lord, they enjoy the blissful electric radiance of the union. They hear the sound of unstruck music loud and clear.

gurmukhi: ਨਿਝਰ ਅਪਾਰ ਧਾਰ ਬਰਖਾ ਅੰਮ੍ਰਿਤ ਜਲ ਸੇਵਕ ਸਕਲ ਫਲ ਸਰਬ ਨਿਧਾਨ ਹੈ ||੫੯||
transliteration: Nijhar Apaar Dhaar Barakhaa Anmrit Jala , Sayvak Sakal Dhal Sarab Nidhaan Hai ?59?
translation: They perpetually enjoy the continuous flow of the divine elixir in the Dasam Duar and the seekers obtain all the fruits and treasures. (59)
